title.narrative: Rapid response to and mitigation of public health risks in drought-affected districts of Jubaland state (Afmadow and Kismayo, Dobley, Baardheere, Luuq, Dolow) and SouthWest State (Baidoa, Marka, Hudur, Barawe, Afgoi and Wajid)

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to strengthen the timely detection and response to alerts of epidemic-prone diseases and other public health risks in drought-affected districts of Jubaland and Southwest states in order to contribute to the reduction in associated morbidity and mortality. To achieve these, WHO will work in collaboration with state ministries of health (MOH). Capacities of frontline health workers will be enhanced through on-the-job refresher trainings and the provision of essential medical and laboratory supplies. To protect communities from vertical transmission of pathogens, WHO will strengthen the implementation of WASH activities, including the management of medical waste. 159 511 people including 90,922 men, 68,589 women, 3273 boys,2469 girls, and 12,761 people living with disabilities will be targeted
